CAREER SUMMARY  
 
March 2022  to date SENSIRON AG  
Position: Key Account Manager – Appliances & HVAC  
Market leader in environmental and flow sensing, designing and manufacturing cutting -
edge technologies . 
• Provide and clearly convey subject matter expertise and sales strategies, 
through customised presentations, to my teams and customers spread 
between the US, Japan, Europe and China . 
• Develop trust with new and existing key customers and prospects through  
seamless cross -functional support, substantiated by my strong integration 
within the company . 
• Carried a new sensor concept from ideation, business case validation to being 
included in the company’s innovation conference . 
• Leveraged negotiations to acquir e new contacts and improve our relationships 
with key customers, and support long -term purchasing engagements . 
 
June to December 2001 HARVARD UNIVERSITY, Cambridge, USA  
Posit ion: Robotics Lead & research Fellow  
Hosted at Pr. Weitz’s lab to develop a novel robotic platform for high performance 
composite ma nufacturing . 
• Develop strategically our value proposition and interview key market 
incumbent. Code, at times . 
    
• Create fundraising presentation material, participate in pitches. Won a $20k 
startup challenge . 
 
Jan 2019 to Jul 202 1 Alpha ECO AG  (eGain Switzerland)  
Position: Energy Monit oring Manager  
Machine learning and IoT solution to reduce the energy consumption of buildings by 
up to 20%  
• Recruit, train, and supervise 2 analysts to monitor and provide system reports 
to increase energy savings . 
• Improve client satisfaction, first point of contact  for emergencies, and oversee 
on-site interventions . 
 
2016 to 2018 Junior Enterpr ise EPFL  
Position: President & Project Ma nager  
Volunteer student organisation undertaking client projects with university students 
(CHF400k revenue)  
• All of his  clients engaged in multiple projects with the organisation (25+ 
projects). Increased turn over +30% . 
• Lead 35-strong team to win the highest network distinction: Best European 
Junior Entreprise 2018 . 
 
 
COMMENT  
 
Mechanical engineer with B2B sales experience and tech startup exposure at Harvard 
University Team player, with a passion for building strong partner relationships and 
technology . 
 
T skills: Python (Applied ML, Automation, Data visualisation), C++, Excel, ThinkCell, 
Powerpoint  
 
For further information please contact Julie Smith or Jan Johnston on 01695 570 696 
or email  julie.smith @johnston -vere.co.uk

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
